page.title: 01EVERSHOLT
page.content:
This very scattered village is located to the east of Woburn Park. It is unusual in that each part of the village is an 'end'. According to the guide to the local area produced by the Mid Bedfordshire District Council, it has numerous ends and not much of a middle. This sums it up rather well.
The village has about 450 inhabitants spread between the various ends which probably came about when squatters formed small isolated settlements a few hundred years ago. The name Eversholt is of Danish origin and means 'home of the boar'.
The church is mainly 14th and 15th century with a few remains back to Norman times. There are Edwardian murals and glass.
